column4: why wont my flash drive mount,  it says it already is when i do the sudo command, but damned if i can find how to open the contents in a graphical user interface... i am a poweruser, why does linux start doing really KOOKY things?
« mount » should show you where it is mounted
i am getting all these error messages when i do the "mount" command
share :)

did you sort out your flash issue?
your earlier pastebin shows you trying to mount /dev/sda1.  That's definitely not your flash drive
i just don't understand why when i plug it in sometimes it discovers and then other times it doesn't it is so fickle
check dmeg when it fails to mount when you plug it in if you want  to investigate
dmeg? or http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmesg
I meant "dmesg", typo
most commandline is gobbleygook to me but i bumble my way thru http://paste.ubuntu.com/586143/
/dev/sdb1 is what you should be trying to mount
